1.title: Automation Engineer
1.description: My main focus were regression testing of new builds and acceptance tests of release candidates for the Avira Antivirus suite for Windows.

2.title: Automation Engineer
2.description: To improve the connection between testers and developers, I was one of three Automation Engineers that moved directly into the Windows Development department to drive the automation testing and maintenance in a team of 7 people. I also migrated our performance testing suite and, since then, maintain it.

3.title: Apprentice
3.description: At Ravitec, I was part of a small team of 5 persons. I was mainly busy with maintenance - keeping customers' software up to date, installing new hardware and supporting customers. Also, I could get some additional experience with the administration of Windows Servers.

4.title: Apprentice
4.description: At Avira, I had the opportunity to change my profession from systems integration to software development. I went through several departments, e.g. development, continuous integration & QA, accounting and controlling. I had several projects, e.g. a web-frontend for the analysis of automated performance tests. I spent the last year completely in the Continuous Integration department, my aim was to fully focus on automated software testing, which should later become my job.
